area_name: Grotto & Base of Great White Throne

climbs.name: Batteries not Included
climbs.fa: FA: Gaar Lausman, Zach Lee 2007                              FFA Gaar Lausman 2008

content.description:
This is not the name..  Thanksgiving 2007, I cleanded the old anchor (loose tree) and put in a 2-bolt anchor.

Climb straight in fingers to rattly fingers, to a nice Zion loose corner.
Climb the hand a fist crack for 70 ft, traverse left 5 ft and chimmny kinda thing with a finger crack in the back to sling anchor on a ledge
content.protection: Single set up to 3.5 camolot..Doubles or even Triples on #3
content.location: Walk the base of the wall to the highest point on the trail.

content.description:
The crux is a couple chimney moves down low (large cams protect) but the bulk of the climb is a clean handcrack in a shallow left facing corner. It steepens a bit near the top so make sure you save some gear. If the leader takes up a camera you can get some great shots of the second coming up.

2 bolt rap anchor. You need two ropes to get down.
content.protection: Mostly thin hands to wide hands and something big for the start.
content.location: This is near the west end of the south face, on the base of the Great White Throne. Rookie Crack is just right of Grasshopper.

content.description: 1st pitch of fun hand crack and stemming through a wedge up to a tree. It looks like there is a second pitch of maybe thin hands. Don't know what's up there
content.protection: Mostly hand size. Extra 2's / 3's depending on your comfort level. a red metolius or maybe bd 0.5 is nice for the top.
content.location:
Left of freebird, which is left of Box Elder Jam, the obvious high dihedral with bolts at the top.

Descent: We rapped off the tree (which is large, solid, and slung with new stuff).

content.description: Climb Zion funky for 20ft throwing in a large cam, then enjor very tight hands, to a corner change where you get to finger layback.
content.protection: Double set yellow TCU-2 camolot...1 or 2 5-6 camolot

content.description:
This is quite the intimidating lead. Come prepared with an arsenal of big cams. It is much longer and wider than it looks from the ground.

Start about 30 feet left of Rookie Crack. Scramble up some loose rock to the base of the crack. Hand and fist jam through the initial overhanging buldge to get established in the offwidth. The rest of the climb is relatively easy and hard to fall out of, but man it's a long way to those anchors. The crack is #4 Camalot for a ways (which might be fists for some people) and then it widens to #5's for the second half. 3 bolt anchor and rappel. You need two ropes to get down.
content.protection: Some hand or fist sized stuff for the start and then as many #4's and #5's as you can get a hold of.
content.location: The attractive right facing corner just left of Rookie Crack, on the south face of the Great White Throne.

content.description:
Climb a Dark Right Facing Corner for 80ft to a 2 bolt anchor.

Conteniue up liebacking and Jaming up the widness out roof to anchor.
content.location: 60ft Left of Scotch on the Rocks

content.description:
Climb the left facing beautifull tight hands corner to a roof. Step left and set up an anchor off the 2 inch tree! (Bring a hand Drill!!!) Climb the wide layback flake, to a 2 bolt anchor.

There is a 3rd pitch that looks beautifull, it has anchors but know nothing about it
content.location: As soon as the approach tril hits the base of the wall this is the first thing you see..Just look for the 200ft flake from the parking lot

content.description: Start by laybacking a flake up to an under cling and place your first piece. Make sure to sling this as if you dont the rope will go into the crack for the next thirty feet. From here continue up using the hand crack and patina. The crack will widen and become slightly vegetated, watch for sharp branches here. Another 20 feet oh jamming leads to the crux where the crack recesses in the back of a large flare and the feet disappear.
content.protection: doubles from .5 to 3 and maybe a #4. Two bolt anchor with quicklinks on the bottom bolt
content.location: The base is in a clearing 30 feet up the hill from the Birthday corner and ten feet right of a beautiful finger crack.

content.description: Blocky start to the first tree with a cord around it about 15' feet up. From that point it turns into an off-width flake that can either be jammed or lie-backed up to the second tree with slings (backed up with a nut). Moving from the tree to the crack above is the crux, don't use the tree to yard up, it will break. From there is a hand/fist cruise, the only redeeming part of the climb, I guess.
content.protection: A .75 works for the start, then goes to Camalot 3 and up after the first tree with a big piece nice going into the roof. After the tree pro goes at Camalot 2 to the anchor. Either rap to first or second tree then to ground, a 60m rope wont make the ground.
content.location: As you come around the corner from the Grotto, the first turn out on the right side. If you ask real nice the bus driver might just let you off right there otherwise its a short walk. The 'climbers' trail is really faint here but head pretty much straight at the cliff.

content.description:
Climb the clean cut Left Facing Dihedral.

Start by climbing and easy, protected slab crack, make an exciting 8ft traverse right to the corner.  Stem, and Float your way up the corner. One bolt anchor under roof, Back up with a nut for TR'ing
content.protection: Two-Grey TCU, Three-Purple TCU, Two-Blu TCU, sigle-.75-4 camolot...That will SOW it up
content.location: Keep following the trail along the base for another 5 min  from "One for the Road" to climbers left.

pathTokens: Grotto & Base of Great White Throne
